snippet: Economists warn that over the long term, Spain will have trouble meeting its substantial financial requirements until foreign investors inject new money.
abstract: Chief buyers of Spanish bonds sold by the government to finance its bailout of banks are the banks themselves; economists warn that over the long term, Spain will have trouble meeting its substantial financial requirements until foreign investors return to the market as regular buyers, injecting new money into the system; lately, much of the foreign money has been staying away.
lead_paragraph: Economists warn that over the long term, Spain will have trouble meeting its substantial financial requirements until foreign investors inject new money.
